com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.uninstall

Class DeregisterStep

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.plan.AbstractStep
      • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.uninstall.UninstallStep
        • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.uninstall.DeregisterStep
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Element, Interruptible, Step

    public class DeregisterStep
extends UninstallStep
    Step which advertises that the service has been deregistered and has completed uninstall. This is the last step in an uninstall plan, and it acts as a gate on advertising a completed uninstall to Cosmos. After this step is complete, the scheduler process should soon be destroyed.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.plan.AbstractStep

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from interface: Step
        Starts the Step, whose Status should be Status.PENDING. This will continue to be called for as long as Element.isPending() returns true.

        See #updateOfferStatus(Collection<org.apache.mesos.Protos.Offer.Operation>) which returns the outcome of the PodInstanceRequirement

      • setComplete

        public void setComplete()
        Marks this step complete after the framework has been deregistered. At this point, the overall deploy plan for uninstall should be complete, and the Scheduler process should be destroyed by DC/OS soon after.
